abstract.p: Richard M Frauenglass letter says that prosecution and extradition of Slobodan Milosevic for war crimes would delay Serbia's democratic process (Oct 7 editorial)

block.p: Re ''The Tenacity of Madeleine Albright'' (editorial, Oct. 7):

Re ''The Tenacity of Madeleine Albright'' (editorial, Oct. 7):

If the price of democracy in Yugoslavia is permitting Slobodan Milosevic to remain, then it is a small price indeed. Prosecutors in criminal cases routinely grant plea bargains either to assure some conviction, speed up the wheels of justice or to gain evidence against another person or persons.

It is to Dr. Albright's credit that she demonstrated the tenacity and acuteness that resulted in the overthrow of a dictator and his eventually being criminally charged at The Hague. But to insist on extraditing Mr. Milosevic would delay the democratic process.

Let us accept that the greater good has been served, the voice of the Yugoslav people has been heard and obeyed, and that as much as we might like another outcome, Yugoslavia has now joined the democratic countries of the world, peacefully.
RICHARD M. FRAUENGLASS Huntington, N.Y., Oct. 7, 2000
